intro: Diacrodon compressus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or desert environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with upright stems and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of xerophytic ecosystems.
